html: APOSTLE PAUL’S MINISTRYCOMMISSIONED by Jesus to be an apostle to the nations, Paul zealously carried out his assignment. (Ro 11:13) His first missionary trip took him through Cyprus and into Asia Minor. He was thrown out of cities by angry mobs, even stoned and left for dead. But he returned to strengthen those who had become disciples.On his second trip, he reached into Macedonia and Greece. Here he was able to give a witness at the Areopagus in Athens, as illustrated below.On Paul’s third trip, he preached for some three years in Ephesus, a crossroads of the Roman world. Then he went on to Macedonia and Greece to build up the congregations there.When being held prisoner by the Roman government, Paul used his time well to write inspired letters that are part of the Bible today.[Maps on page 747](For fully formatted text, see publication)PAUL’S FIRST MISSIONARY TRIPFirst trip: Ac 13:1–14:28Paul’s RouteRoadsPAMPHYLIATarsusDerbeLystraIconiumGALATIAAntiochPISIDIAPergaAttaliaAntiochSeleuciaSYRIACYPRUSSalamisPaphosPAUL’S SECOND MISSIONARY TRIPSecond trip: Ac 15:36–18:22Paul’s RouteRoadsSYRIAAntiochCILICIADerbePAMPHYLIAGALATIALystraIconiumPHRYGIAASIABITHYNIAMYSIATroasPhilippiAmphipolisThessalonicaBeroeaAthensCorinthEphesusMediterranean SeaCRETECYPRUSCaesareaJerusalemPAUL’S THIRD MISSIONARY TRIPThird trip: Ac 18:23–21:19Paul’s RouteRoadsAntiochGALATIAPHRYGIAEphesusTroasMACEDONIAPhilippiGREECEAssosMITYLENECHIOSSAMOSMiletusCOSPataraRHODESMediterranean SeaCRETECYPRUSTyrePtolemaisCaesareaJerusalem[Map on page 750](For fully formatted text, see publication)PAUL’S TRIP TO ROMETo Rome as a prisoner: Ac 23:11–28:31Paul’s RouteCaesareaSidonCYPRUSCILICIAGALATIAMyraASIACnidusCRETECAUDAMediterranean SeaSyrtisMACEDONIAITALYMALTASICILYSyracuseRhegiumPuteoliRome[Picture on page 748]Damascus, the street called Straight.
